content.description:
A new addition to the San Pedro wall. This route tops out the formation and you can walk off the backside. It also features great gear/rock and comfy bolted belay stances, along with afternoon shade. The crux of the route is pitch 3 where you move up and right off an exposed ledge.

 Pitch 1 - Go up a vegetated ramp and scope out the short hand crack. Follow it up to a small ledge and up to a two bolt anchor beneath the obvious large roof.  5.8, 100'

 Pitch 2 -Traverse left and around the corner to the South side of the formation. Climb a short corner and belay on bolts. 5.6, 60'

 Pitch 3 - A few steep and exposed 5.10- moves right and then up take you to an enjoyable 5.8 varied wide crack and up to the “Dabaloni Ledge”. 5.10-, 100'

 We didn't climb it, but a 5.7-8-ish-looking variation with good pro exists off of the belay to the left. This can be used to skip the crux, bringing the route down to the 5.8-level.

 Pitch 4 - From the ledge pick and choose a fun way to the top. Steep 5.7 on featured cracks and chicken heads! 5.7, 70'

 Have fun!
content.protection: A nice selection of single cams up to # 4 camalot BD. Passive pro works well on the upper pitches.
content.location: Starts in the center of the wall beneath an obvious large roof and left of a leaning pillar with bolts (the route Mixed Decisions).

content.description:
Enjoy some short layback followed by easy face. I slung a tree at the top and traversed far left to Blackhawk's anchors and had my second follow up the route. Dirty.

 I thought this was Rochelle's Roof but I didn't see any bolts or chains. Not sure if someone has climbed this before but my guess is they have. Please update this route if you have information!
content.location: To the right of Dr D., starting where the hanging blocks are. They are a bit hollow. You will have to climb up some easy slab to get to these blocks.

content.protection: Tcu's and Camalots to #4. Lots of long slings.

climbs.name: Mixed Decisions
climbs.fa: Charlie King, Andy Tretiakoff, Nick Spriggshall

content.description: The crux is near the top with rather trickey gear placements. The  step off the pillar onto the face is easy and I've been told it can be protected with a (Green Alien).This route was originally led by "Charlie King" with only "2 bolts." A 3rd bolt has been added later on the crux. Partners are telling me another should be added due to the danger of a fall stepping out onto the face which would slam a leader onto the pillar below should one fall here although it's an easy move. Also been told it should be rated R if another is not added? The 3rd bolt being added was already controversial.
content.protection: Nuts, micro camalots and long slings. 3 lead bolts/Chain Anchors.
content.location: First route encountered and can be indenitfied by looking for 2 bolts on a leaning pillar.

climbs.name: Horny Lizards
climbs.fa: Andy  Tretiakoff, Charlie King, Nick Spriggshall,Sharon Legg

content.description: The crux is the last 15Ft.and protected with 3 bolts.
content.protection: Tcu's and Camalots to #2. Rap from 2 Fixe rings back to the chains for "Blackhawk." You will have to swing over to the right to get to the chains. Two single rope raps get you down.
content.location: Follow crack and small seams over bulge directly above chain anchors. The chains here are for "Mixed Decisions" and "Blackhawk."

climbs.name: Flight of the Peregrine
climbs.fa: Sharon Legg, Andy P. Nick Spriggshall

content.description: The crux is the crack that goes left of the roof.
content.protection: Tcu's and Camalots to #3. Long slings. Use chains on time capsule.
content.location: The climb starts left of pine tree that is next to the wall. Climb crack up left of obvious roof to arete with 2 bolts.

climbs.name: Dr. D & Mr. P go PC

content.description: Thought we were headed for Blackhawk, climbed this obvious dihedral instead. Loose rock, thick bushes at base and lichen in cracks make me think it was unclimbed. Steep start on right (direct start probably OK too) to death block on right of crack. Difficult to pass with out laying off of it, really needs to be trundled. Short steep section above, lots of lichen in the cracks. Could be a two or three star route with cleaning.
content.protection: Regular rack to # 2 camalot. short route.
content.location: Between Blackhawk and Rochelle's Roof, directly behind large phone pole-like snag. Bushwhack in from R. or pass through Hobbit Hole on L near Mixed Decision's Pillar.    Exit up and L. to chains on top of Blackhawk/Decisions.

climbs.name: Blackhawk
climbs.fa: Andy P, Charlie King, Nick S, Tony R

content.description: Scramble to start of climb right of Pillar/Mixed Decisions. Shares anchors with Mixed Decisions. Some hallow flakes on this route.

climbs.name: 15 Pesos
climbs.fa: Nick Spriggshall, Sharon Legg, Andy P. Tretiakoff

content.description: Climb most obvious crack line directly above 2 bolt belay. If you want a harder start there is a 5.8- crack that goes left up through bulge. If you want you can rap from here to do the 1st. pitch of this route or do the climb called the Orphan. The description above is for the 2nd. pitch.
content.protection: Tcu's and Camalots to # 4.and a lot of long slings. 2 bolt belay up top with Metolius rap anchors. Single rope rap will get you back to the ledge. It's 100 Ft. so watch the end of the rope!
content.location: This route is on the far east end of the wall. The top of the first pitch can be found up top of a slab. Sramble up 3rd or 4th class and you will see 2 metolius rap anchors.

content.description: This area has very little shade,   but almost always has a nice breeze blowing up from around the corner. It's location gives it a secluded feeling and has some great views of San Pedro Valley. The rock is granite and the quality is mostly excellent. The wall faces southeast and is probably best climbed spring, summer and fall!
